title.narrative: VH2- QUALITY, INTEGRATED HIV SERVICES PROVISION (PREVENTION AND CARE)

description.narrative: By the end of 2021, health facilities and communities offer integrated, quality and equitable services for behavior change promotion, testing, ARV treatment and monitoring of HIV viral load among children, adolescents and prevention of mother-to-child transmission, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: PMTCT program support such as retention in care, family planning, infant feeding, infant medical male circumcision and community facility linkages
Procurement and or supply management for HIV diagnostics and medicine
Technical assistance - Treatment and care of children living with HIV

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2021, health facilities and communities offer integrated, quality and equitable services for behavior change promotion, testing, ARV treatment and monitoring of HIV viral load among children, adolescents and prevention of mother-to-child transmission, including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: 88% (74011/82700) new pregnant women who attended ANC were screened for HIV with 1966 (2.6%) positive enrolled in PMTCT. 3092 (62% of the target) HIV pregnant women were put on ART (978 from emergency zone). 79% (1340/1691) of children born from HIV mothers were put on prophylaxis ART (450 from emergency zone). Mother to child transmission rate was 14% (89/638) for the beneficiaries enrolled in the program. 10446 children/adolescent screened for HIV out of which 267 put on ART. 35% (3332/9400) of <14 years children living with HIV were put on ART, including 831 under 2nd line. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of districts that are implementing at least 3 high impact adolescent prevention interventions
Children with severe acute malnutrition referred for an HIV test

target.value: 2021:At least 80% of districts refer children with SAM for HIV testing

title.narrative: Mother to child HIV transmission rate

baseline.value: 64 sites out of the 91 national wide offer ART for pediatric care

title.narrative: HIV positive pregnant women screened and put on ARVs

title.narrative: Comprehensive behaviour change communication strategy for adolescents and youth including those from key populations available
